column4: I am having a VCD with .dat file and it is not being supported by any players on Ubuntu karmic, Which codec will should solve the problem?
libdvd?
hwait
do you have mplayer installed?  in a terminal try "mplayer -vo x11 vcd://1" the 1 is the first track perhaps try 2 and 3 if the first fails
is this a file or a disk?
do you have mplayer installed?
sudo apt-get install mplayer-nogui
oh it's installed then!
mplayer vcd://1
mplayer vcd://1 if at all possible if you could pastbin the output from the terminal, if it doesn't start playing would be awesome
try "mplayer vcd://2" - it sees that the VCD has 2 tracks!
there are GUI frontend to mplayer
and you are typing my nic incorrectly - so i'm not getting highlights
Z - y - TABKEY
thanks!  no problem - glad to help!
wait!
what?
are you still using the "-vo x11" in your command?
yes
you don't want that!  probably, try "-vo gl" instead - the x11 might not go fullscreen!
the command you gave I am just using it,
ok
it's just a text file - open it with gedit or any other text editor
oops! I am feeling foolish, lol, thank you :)
